intro: Lotononis platycarpa var. persica, commonly known as the Persian lotonon, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pale blue or purple. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain small, black seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
